intro: Tecoma lepidophylla var. reticulata, commonly known as the net-veined golden shower tree, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its delicate, feathery leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in pendulous clusters. The plant belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for tropical and subtropical landscapes. Its unique floral structure and seasonal blooming make it a distinctive addition to botanical collections.
